'''''Ye Chequers Clubbe Binge'''''<ref group=note>''[[wiktionary:ye#Etymology 2|ye]]'' is the conventional spelling for ''þe'' "the", as the typographical glyph for y was similar to the letter þ which was unavailable as a glyph. It is intended to be pronounced as ''the''; [[Wikipedia:English articles#Ye form|see here]]. The title is an example of [[Wikipedia:ye olde|humorous anachronism]].</ref> is the title of a printed menu for a five course dinner, for the [[Chequers Clubbe]]. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] provided the cover artwork for the menu card. The menu was reprinted in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Life and Legend]]''.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=11340|articlename=Chequers Clubbe Binge. 1914|dated=|website=TB|accessed=13 February 2012}}</ref>
